page.title: 11A Local Farm
page.content:
Elms Farm was a dairy farm that we visited.There were just a hundred cows.They give 300 gallons of milk a day.We watched the cows being milked.We saw the bull who was called Leofric Donald.A calf had been born two hours before we arrived. {Lucy. On Wednesday we went to Elms Farm.There are 250 acres.There is one Hereford bull called Leofric Donald and there are a hundred cows.Some of the cows are black and white Fresians and some them are brown Charolais.They give 300 gallons of milk each day, which is 2,400 bottles of milk. {Kym.
When the boy cows are three years old they go to the butcher.The bull stays otherwise there would be no babies.The women are lucky.They go for milk. {Louise.
